title: Domain-Specific Usability of LLMs in Medical Applications
description: Assess the usability of LLMs in domain-specific medical applications, focusing on their ability to provide accurate and explainable clinical recommendations.
motivation: General LLMs often struggle with domain-specific tasks, such as medical applications. Evaluating their usability in these contexts can lead to more effective and reliable medical tools.
milestones: Define project scope and objectives.
Conduct a literature review on LLMs and their applications in medicine.
Identify specific medical domains for assessment.
Design a methodology for usability assessment.
Acquire necessary datasets for evaluation.
Prepare and preprocess datasets for LLM evaluation.
Select appropriate LLM models for assessment.
Develop a framework for evaluating LLM usability.
Conduct initial LLM evaluations on preselected tasks.
Analyze initial results to identify trends and issues.
Iterate on the evaluation methodology as needed.
Expand evaluation to additional medical domains.
Conduct comprehensive usability testing across domains.
Analyze results for accuracy and explainability.
Compile findings into a comprehensive report.
Draft a paper for publication in a peer-reviewed journal.
Prepare a presentation for stakeholders.
Conduct a peer review of the draft paper.
Incorporate feedback from peer review.
Finalize the paper for submission.
